Can someone please explain how a heat shield works when you're dealing with the engines facing down? I'm imagining that the engine parts are taking the most stress (b/c it's facing down), so where is the heat shield?  Also, while I'm blown away at this technological break through, I wonder how SpaceX will make space flight affordable if they are not able to re-use the 2nd stage...my guess is that it's still $15M for that piece of the vehicle. I wouldn't imagine that commercial aviation would be feasible if $15M worth of a Boeing 777 much be replaced after each flight.  Am I missing something here?  Either way, it's still a breakthru and I'm not trying to down-play this remarkable achievement.
